thread.title: This Artist’s Instagram Account Is Depicting Eating Disorders In a Profound Way
thread.title_full: This Artist’s Instagram Account Is Depicting Eating Disorders In a Profound Way

author: Abby Heugel
title: This Artist’s Instagram Account Is Depicting Eating Disorders In a Profound Way
text:
Over 3 million people just like you 'Like' us » Like it? Share it! 259 Shares 
Eating disorders are so complicated — and dangerous — because they're not one-size-fits all. Some people starve, some overexercise, some purge, some think they're fat, some have no body issues but use it to deal with anxiety. 
There's no all-encompassing experience, which is why they're so often misunderstood. Christie Begnell , 24, is a Syndey-based illustrator who began drawing visual representations of her anorexia while attending a private clinic. via: Instagram 
After a difficult breakup that coincided with family, work, and university struggles Begnell first began to notice symptoms of her eating disorder. 
“With my world falling apart, suicidal thoughts and self-hatred were at their peak,” she said . “I had started dieting after gaining a bit of breakup weight but it very quickly became an obsession.” To help illustrate her struggle, she literally started illustrating her struggle and sharing it on Instagram. A post shared by Christie Begnell (@meandmyed.art) on Feb 3, 2017 at 2:33pm PST Begnell collated her eating disorder illustrations in her book, Me and My ED . A post shared by Christie Begnell (@meandmyed.art) on Feb 6, 2017 at 3:32pm PST She highlights the physical and mental health implications of the disease, which is about more than just body image. A post shared by Christie Begnell (@meandmyed.art) on Jan 29, 2017 at 3:46pm PST 22 Words Rocks ...AND GETS ALL UP IN YOUR FACEBOOK More posts in #Art
